bioghist.p: Colonel Thomas Forster (1762-1836) was agent of Erie County for the Harrisburg and Presque Isle Land Company, collector for the Port of Erie from 1799 to 1836, and government agent for the construction of the breakwater in Erie harbor. Forster led a volunteer regiment during the Whiskey Insurrection was was the first surveyor of the City of Erie.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of papers of Thomas Forster. Materials include: account books; bills and receipts; check registers; articles of agreement and indentures; summaries of legal cases; and correspondence largely related to financial matters and to the Port of Erie and the Erie and Waterford Turnpike. The collection also includes recent handwritten transcripts of many of the documents in the collection.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
